means: 伤害，虐待，不亲切的行为

sentence.Network_en: He said the protesters were doing a disservice to the nation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说抗议者正对国家造成危害。

sentence.Network_en: We will never do any disservice to you [ anything to hurt you ].
sentence.Network_cn: 我们决不会做任何对不起你们的事情.

sentence.Network_en: The spreading of such ideas is of great disservice to the state.
sentence.Network_cn: 散布这种思想,对国家极为不利.

list.abs: do a disservice to the public ., 反而会危害公众利益.
They do a great disservice to our society ., 他们给我们的社会带来很大危害.
The spreading of such ideas is of great disservice to the state ., 散布这种思想 , 对国家极为不利.

RelatedPhrase.word: damage harm hurt injure disservice injury knife wound

list.key: damage harm hurt injure disservice injury knife wound
list.abs: damage harm hurt injure disservice injury knife wound ., 伤害还有很多单词.

entry.def: If you do someone or something a disservice, you harm them in some way.

example.ex: He said the protesters were doing a disservice to the nation...
example.tran: 他说抗议者正对国家造成危害。

example.ex: You could do yourself a grave disservice by revealing all to a potential rival.
example.tran: 将一切都透露给潜在的竞争对手只会给自己帮倒忙。

means.word_mean: 1. an act intended to help that turns out badly;

auth_sentence.content: It did a serious disservice to half the population.
auth_sentence.res_content: It did a serious disservice to half the population.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It did a serious disservice to half the population.

auth_sentence.content: But that would be doing it a disservice.
auth_sentence.res_content: But that would be doing it a disservice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But that would be doing it a disservice.

auth_sentence.content: I wonder if I did a disservice to The Interpreter.
auth_sentence.res_content: I wonder if I did a disservice to The Interpreter.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I wonder if I did a disservice to The Interpreter.
